intro: Drypetes klainei, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The tree has compound leaves with long, slender leaflets and produces small, fleshy fruits that are yellow when ripe. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can grow up to 15 meters in height. The plant is adapted to thrive in full sun and well-drained soils, making it suitable for tropical and subtropical climates.
